newsitem.title: USA: UnionTexas to buy stake in Phillips China prospect.
newsitem.headline: UnionTexas to buy stake in Phillips China prospect.

text.p: Union Texas Petroleum Holdings said Wednesday it agreed in principle to acauire a 40 percent stake in the exploration block in Bohai Bay offshore People's Republic of China.
Union Texas will buy the interest from Phillips Petroleum Co's China subsidiary, which will retain 60 pct and remain operator, Union Texas said in a statement.
Terms of the acquisition, which is subject to final approvals from China National Offshore Oil Corp, were not disclosed.

The 2.27 million-acre Bohai Bay block is situated 60 miles offshore China in water depths averaging 80 feet. The venture currently plans to drill two exploration wells in 1997 and two wells in 1998-99.
During 1996, Phillips drilled its initial exploration well which, although noncommercial, flowed at a rate of 6.6 million cubic feet of gas and 166 barrels of condensate per day.
The new venture is part of UnionTexas's drive to expand into promising new areas, said Chairman and CEO John Whitmire.

"In the past few weeks, we have also announced other new exploration ventures in Jordan, Yemen, Bolivia, Greece and Papua New Guinea. In addition, there are other new exploration projects that are being finalized," Whitmire said.

One of the largest independent producers located in the U.S, Houston-based Union Texas Petroleum Holdings, Inc. explores for and produces oil and gas overseas primarily in the U.K. North Sea, Indonesia and other strategic areas (Pakistan).
